item.title: پریا add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "No medicine cures what happiness cannot." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: پریا add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He dug so deeply into her sentiments that in search of interest he found love, because by trying to make her love him he ended up falling in love with her. Petra Cotes, for her part, loved him more and more as she felt his love increasing, and that was how in the ripeness of autumn she began to believe once more in the youthful superstition that poverty was the servitude of love. Both looked back then on the wild revelry, the gaudy wealth, and the unbridled fornication as an annoyance and they lamented that it had cost them so much of their lives to find the paradise of shared solitude. Madly in love after so many years of sterile complicity, they enjoyed the miracle of living each other as much at the table as in bed, and they grew to be so happy that even when they were two worn-out people they kept on blooming like little children and playing together like dogs." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: پریا add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "There [is] no innocence more dangerous than the innocence of age." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: پریا add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: پریا add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: پریا add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description:
"Few people are capable of expressing with equanimity opinions which differ from the prejudices of their social enviroment. Most people are incapable of forming such opinions."
(<i>Essay to Leo Baeck</i>, 1953)" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It seems to me that the idea of a personal God is an anthropological concept which I cannot take seriously. I also cannot imagine some will or goal outside the human sphere... Science has been charged with undermining morality, but the charge is unjust. A man's ethical behavior should be based effectually on sympathy, education, and social ties and needs; no religious basis is necessary. Man would indeed be in a poor way if he had to be restrained by fear of punishment and hope of reward after death." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A person starts to live when he can live outside himself." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "An empty stomach is not a good political adviser." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description:
"All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree. All these aspirations are directed toward ennobling man's life, lifting it from the sphere of mere physical existence and leading the individual towards freedom."
[<i>Moral Decay</i> (first published 1937)]" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: پریا add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding." -- Albert Einstein
